20101224140936.000|20101224140938.000|TR0|year ago.  Thirty-six percent said that 
20101224140938.000|20101224140940.000|TR0|the economy has not forced cut backs.  And 
20101224140940.000|20101224140942.000|TR0|a year ago, 44 percent gave that response.

20101224142840.000|20101224142843.000|TR0|cost of all time.  I know, it sounds 
20101224142843.000|20101224142845.000|TR0|crazy.  But take a look at this.  
20101224142845.000|20101224142847.000|TR0|According to the labor department, toys 
20101224142847.000|20101224142849.000|TR0|today are 55 percent cheaper than in 1980. 
20101224142849.000|20101224142851.000|TR0|Televisions are 93 percent cheaper than 
20101224142851.000|20101224142853.000|TR0|they were in 1980 and clothes are 20 
20101224142853.000|20101224142856.000|TR0|percent cheaper than we spent on the 
20101224142856.000|20101224142858.000|TR0|threads in 1995.
20101224142858.000|20101224142900.000|TR0|
20101224142900.000|20101224142902.000|TR0|Now, as for the small appliances, they are 
20101224142902.000|20101224142904.000|TR0|about 30 percent cheaper than in 1998.  
20101224142904.000|20101224142906.000|TR0|And these numbers, they're, actually, not 
20101224142906.000|20101224142909.000|TR0|adjusted for inflation.  So, the big 
20101224142909.000|20101224142911.000|TR0|question there is, obviously, how's this 
20101224142911.000|20101224142913.000|TR0|possible?  Well, if a gadget for your kid 
20101224142913.000|20101224142915.000|TR0|costs a hundred bucks in 1980, in today's 
20101224142915.000|20101224142917.000|TR0|dollars, that's $45.  Of course, it does 
20101224142917.000|20101224142919.000|TR0|go both ways, so $100 from today would be 
20101224142919.000|20101224142922.000|TR0|worth $265 if you could go back to 1980.  
20101224142922.000|20101224142924.000|TR0|So, $265 there.
20101224142924.000|20101224142926.000|TR0|
20101224142926.000|20101224142928.000|TR0|Now, prices have plunged because of 
20101224142928.000|20101224142930.000|TR0|improvements in technology, manufacturing 
20101224142930.000|20101224142932.000|TR0|has gotten better and the influence of 
20101224142932.000|20101224142935.000|TR0|those big box stores in the retail 
20101224142935.000|20101224142937.000|TR0|environment has, also, played its part.  
20101224142937.000|20101224142939.000|TR0|Plus, we now have a global economy where

20101224142941.000|20101224142943.000|TR0|the world and that's, obviously, the most 
20101224142943.000|20101224142945.000|TR0|obvious in electronics. But if you want to

20101224144732.000|20101224144734.000|TR0|
20101224144734.000|20101224144737.000|TR0|ZAIN VERJEE, CNN CORRESPONDENT:  I know.  
20101224144737.000|20101224144739.000|TR0|I'm bursting a lot of people's bubbles 
20101224144739.000|20101224144741.000|TR0|here today, Kyra.  It may surprise you and 
20101224144741.000|20101224144743.000|TR0|the rest of our newsroom here, who was 
20101224144743.000|20101224144745.000|TR0|very upset to find out that Santa is not 
20101224144745.000|20101224144747.000|TR0|from the North Pole or from Lapland but 
20101224144747.000|20101224144750.000|TR0|actually from Demre in Turkey.
20101224144750.000|20101224144752.000|TR0|
20101224144752.000|20101224144754.000|TR0|Not, it all comes from a Sixth Century 
20101224144754.000|20101224144756.000|TR0|period where there was a man called St. 
20101224144756.000|20101224144758.000|TR0|Nicholas, and he was a bishop who gave 
20101224144758.000|20101224144800.000|TR0|gifts to the poor.  And that legend, Kyra, 
20101224144800.000|20101224144803.000|TR0|kind of evolved into Santa Claus.
20101224144803.000|20101224144805.000|TR0|
20101224144805.000|20101224144807.000|TR0|Today they say there's no magical powers 
20101224144807.000|20101224144809.000|TR0|around Santa Claus.  He was just a regular 
20101224144809.000|20101224144811.000|TR0|guy who did great things.  But, Kyra, you 
20101224144811.000|20101224144813.000|TR0|know what they do?  They call Santa Claus 
20101224144813.000|20101224144815.000|TR0|"Noel Baba" in Turkey, a mainly Muslim 
20101224144815.000|20101224144818.000|TR0|country.  And it's actually a bigger deal 
20101224144818.000|20101224144820.000|TR0|over New Year's.  People will be partying, 
20101224144820.000|20101224144822.000|TR0|dancing and having a good time, but 
20101224144822.000|20101224144824.000|TR0|they'll be dressed up as Santa, Noel Baba.
20101224144824.000|20101224144826.000|TR0|
20101224144826.000|20101224144828.000|TR0|PHILLIPS:  I like that.  It kind of has a 
20101224144828.000|20101224144831.000|TR0|nice ring to it, Noel Baba.  I'm going to
